aboutustitle: Join us in this transformative journey towards a greener, more sustainable future.
aboutusline1: Our vision is to invigorate green projects by facilitating their access to international carbon market funding through our robust carbon registry. This platform empowers project developers to harness vital funds that drive environmental innovation, while buyers of carbon credits gain access to a credible, transparent marketplace for their climate action efforts. Ultimately, the registry is a catalyst for our nation's shift towards a sustainable future, enabling us to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, foster a cleaner environment, and promote socio-economic development.
aboutusline2: When you join our National Carbon Registry, you become part of a meaningful movement for change. For project developers, this platform could be your gateway to funding, offering a space to connect with potential buyers of your carbon credits. For buyers, this is your one-stop-shop to find a broad selection of certified credits, contributing towards your carbon neutral goals. By becoming a member, you are joining a community committed to fostering a healthier environment and a sustainable future for our country.
aboutusline3: The National Carbon Registry is our commitment to transparency and integrity in the carbon market. It's a platform designed to facilitate fair and secure transactions of carbon credits. Our aim is to instill confidence in the market and ensure that everyone's contributions towards reducing greenhouse gases are validated and make a real impact. Together, we can effectively combat climate change and pave the way towards a cleaner, more sustainable future for our country. The concept for our National Carbon Registry evolved out of a need for improved carbon credit management. Under the Paris Agreement, an international consensus was reached acknowledging the crucial role of carbon markets in tackling climate change. But, it was evident that an organized, transparent system was required to facilitate these exchanges.
eligibilitybody: The national carbon registry should be adapted to the national context while following below principles.
analyticbody: Our national carbon registry provides full transparency and traceability of carbon credits, ensuring every credit is accurately recorded, independently verified, and uniquely identifiable, giving you complete confidence in your climate action efforts.
carboncalbody: With our easy-to-navigate platform, you can efficiently explore, validate, and engage with a diverse range of verified green projects, simplifying your access to global carbon markets.
serialgenbody: Our carbon registry not only showcases projects that reduce greenhouse gases, but also those that deliver substantial social and economic benefits, allowing you to contribute to a sustainable and resilient future for our nation.
eliglist1: Scope: The Registry should encompass all significant greenhouse gas emissions and removals happening in the country, covering all sectors and gases.
eliglist2: Transparency: The Registry should make the information about emissions and removals publicly available, fostering understanding, trust, and participation among all stakeholders
eliglist3: Consistency: The registry should align with internationally agreed accounting rules, methodologies, and guidelines, particularly the ones provided by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC).
eliglist4: Integrity: The registry's data and procedures should be subject to regular review and validation by an independent party to ensure its accuracy and credibility.
heroMessage1: Empowering transparency, accountability, and progress, this platform is your gateway to tracking and achieving a sustainable, resilient, and thriving Seychelles.
heroMessage2: Join us in driving meaningful climate action and building a brighter future for all.

card1.title: Centralised Data Collection
card1.description: The Transparency system centralises data from multiple sources, including government agencies and environmental programs, making it easier to track and report climate actions. The system automates data integration, reducing manual work and ensuring accurate, up-to-date information.

card2.title: Real-time Reporting and Analytics
card2.description: The system provides real-time insights and automated reports on climate progress. This allows stakeholders to track Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) and other key climate metrics, ensuring alignment with the Paris Agreement.

card3.title: Secure and Transparent Data Sharing
card3.description: Data within the Transparency is securely stored and made accessible to authorised stakeholders. Public-facing reports provide transparency, allowing everyone to monitor Seychelles' climate progress and fostering trust among the public and international community.

card4.description: The system adheres to international climate reporting frameworks like the UNFCCC and Paris Agreement, ensuring Seychelles meets global expectations and requirements. This guarantees the credibility of the country's climate commitments and strengthens global cooperation.

card5.description: The system promotes collaboration between various ministries, agencies, NGOs, and international organisations. By enhancing coordination, it helps Seychelles maximise the impact of its climate actions and connect with funding opportunities such as the Green Climate Fund.

card6.title: Integrated Financial Tracking
card6.description: The system tracks financial flows related to climate actions, providing visibility into the allocation and use of funds. This ensures that resources are efficiently utilized and helps promote accountability for climate-related spending.

card7.title: User-friendly Interface
card7.description: The system features an intuitive interface with easy-to-navigate dashboards and visual tools. This makes it accessible for both technical and non-technical users, enabling better decision-making based on clear and understandable data insights.

faqs.title: Key Questions About Seychelles' NDC Transparency System

question1.q: What is the Seychelles NDC Transparency System?
question1.a: The Seychelles NDC Transparency System is a cutting-edge platform developed to support the tracking, management, and reporting of climate actions. It enhances transparency and facilitates collaboration among stakeholders while ensuring Seychelles' alignment with global climate frameworks such as the Paris Agreement's Enhanced Transparency Framework (ETF).

question2.q: How does the system support the Seychelles Government's climate commitments?
question2.a: The system enables the government to track and report on climate actions accurately, ensuring timely and transparent reporting in line with international standards. It also improves coordination among ministries and stakeholders to achieve the country’s climate goals.

question3.q: What types of data does the NDC Transparency System handle?
question3.a: The system collects and processes a variety of data including emissions reductions, climate adaptation and mitigation activities, financial flows for climate projects, and progress toward the Seychelles' Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs).

question4.q: How does the system ensure compliance with the Enhanced Transparency Framework (ETF)?
question4.a: The NDC Transparency system automates data collection and reporting, ensuring that all data and climate actions are accurately tracked and aligned with the ETF guidelines. It produces real-time reports that help track progress on climate goals and provide insights for decision-making.

question5.q: Who can access and use the NDC Transparency System?
question5.a: The system is used by government agencies, NGOs, private sector partners, and international bodies such as the UNDP. It is an open-source platform designed to encourage transparency and collaboration across various stakeholders.

question6.q: How does the NDC Transparency System support financial tracking for climate projects?
question6.a: The system tracks financial flows and resource allocations for climate-related projects, helping to identify funding gaps, monitor expenditures, and ensure accountability in the use of climate funds.

question7.q: Can the system integrate with other international climate tracking systems?
question7.a: Yes, the DTS is designed to integrate with global climate tracking platforms such as the UNDP ITMOs platform and the UNFCCC’s systems. This ensures seamless data exchange and alignment with international climate reporting frameworks. Integration with UNFCCC’s is planned for a future phase.

question8.q: How does the system enhance stakeholder engagement?
question8.a: The system provides a transparent view of Seychelles' climate actions, encouraging engagement from civil society, the private sector, and the general public. It fosters collaboration by offering accessible tools for stakeholders to contribute to climate action and decision-making.

question9.q: How will the NDC Transparency System evolve to meet future climate reporting needs?
question9.a: The system is built with scalability in mind. It will be updated regularly to incorporate new functionalities, accommodate increasing data demands, and stay aligned with evolving global climate agreements.

question10.q: How does the DTS ensure data security and integrity?
question10.a: The system employs robust security protocols, including data encryption and secure access controls, to protect sensitive climate data. It ensures data integrity through automated processes that minimize errors and provide a reliable foundation for informed decision-making.
